Running the IO ITs, I see the following warnings in the logs. Please address or add a comment where these are used explaining why it's important to use the version you chose.

mapred.mapoutput.value.class is deprecated. Instead, use mapreduce.map.output.value.class 
mapred.task.id is deprecated. Instead, use mapreduce.task.attempt.id 
mapred.tip.id is deprecated. Instead, use mapreduce.task.id

@ssisk Thanks ! Sure, gonna take a look later today !

In the original PR we devised a way to opt out modules which need to ignore the default shading configuration.

Please see original [PR comment](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2096#issuecomment-286393622)
And accompanying [mail](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/7e57303b5149260eeeb286bf77ec72b64f5b62144cb3db10f5d8ffb0@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E) in the dev list.

@ssisk, cool! I will take a look at this

Looks like the opt-out instructions in [PR #2096 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2096#issuecomment-286393622) were faulty and caused this build to break.
I've since edited the comment with a correct version and opened PR #2259 which uses the fixed version for opting out.

R: @amitsela 
This is a fix for broken master build.

Looks like the opt-out instructions in [PR #2096 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2096#issuecomment-286393622) were faulty and caused master to break. 
I've since edited the comment with a correct version which is the one in this PR.

Uninstalling the tox dependency afterwards is not a good idea because the user could have installed it before so we will change his work environment.
Great idea to continue the discussion/fix in JIRA, doing it right now.
LGTM

@ssisk can you state pros/cons of having:
1. the `PipelineOptions` in each IO (providing integration tests)
vs
2. all options in a "big" `PipelineOptions`.

This module will also contain the Kubernetes scripts, right ? It's the "global" common-io-it shared by any IO providing integration tests.

This work as soon as we release all IOs and common-io-it in a row (in  the same release). If later, we go in a way where we will do individual release of each IO, this approach could be painful.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/8487/
--none--
LGTM

PipelineOptions in each IO:
Pros: no additional benefits that I know (you may have some ideas on this from your experience on other apache projects - please let me know! Remember that we'd still want to do shared test runs)
Cons: 
* options on the command line but not present in the PipelineOptions being used to read them will cause an error (we could in theory remove this error)
* encourages code copying/different command line options even when using the same data store (eg what happens with elasticsearchio and hifio's elasticsearch)


Shared Big PipelineOptions: 
pros/cons are the inverse of the last.

>This module will also contain the Kubernetes scripts, right ?

correct. 

> If later, we go in a way where we will do individual release of each IO, this approach could be painful.

Can you explain that a bit more? I'm guessing you're referring to the idea that the individual IOs would all need to share the common-io-it. It seems like in that world they could still share a test jar. Is that bad?
